metadata.title: Evasion of Antiviral Innate Immunity by Theiler's Virus L* Protein through Direct Inhibition of RNase L

abstract.original_text: Theiler's virus is a neurotropic picornavirus responsible for chronic infections of the central nervous system. The establishment of a persistent infection and the subsequent demyelinating disease triggered by the virus depend on the expression of L*, a viral accessory protein encoded by an alternative open reading frame of the virus. We discovered that L* potently inhibits the interferon-inducible OAS/RNase L pathway.

sentences.segment_text: Theiler 's virus is a neurotropic picornavirus responsible for chronic infections of the central nervous system .
The establishment of a persistent infection and the subsequent demyelinating disease triggered by the virus depend on the expression of L * ,
a viral accessory protein encoded by an alternative open reading frame of the virus .
We discovered that L * potently inhibits the interferon-inducible OAS/RNase L pathway .
